com.rohanclan.cfml.dictionary
Class Trigger

java.lang.Object
  com.rohanclan.cfml.dictionary.Trigger
public class Trigger
extends java.lang.Object

Trigger - represents the attribute conditions required to trigger (allow) an attribute to be available. For example, on the tag the parameter 'source' is available when the 'append' attribute is set to either: copy,move or rename. When that occurs it is not only available, but required as well.

Author:
Oliver Tupman

Method Detail

CreateSimpleTrigger

public static Trigger CreateSimpleTrigger(java.lang.String paramName,
                                          java.lang.String paramVal)
Creates a simple, one attribute set trigger. Just used to reduce the amount of coding required :) This one sets the parameter trigger required value to false.

Parameters:
paramName - Name of the parameter to create the trigger from
paramVal - The value of said trigger
Returns:
The newly created trigger

CreateSimpleTrigger

public static Trigger CreateSimpleTrigger(java.lang.String paramName,
                                          java.lang.String paramVal,
                                          boolean required)
Creates a simple, one attribute set trigger. Just used to reduce the amount of coding required :)

Parameters:
paramName - Name of the parameter to create the trigger from
paramVal - The value of said triggered
required - Whether this trigger triggered means that the parameter must be used
Returns:
The newly created trigger

CreateSimpleTrigger

public static Trigger CreateSimpleTrigger(java.lang.String paramName,
                                          java.lang.String paramVal,
                                          boolean required,
                                          int index)
Creates a simple, one attribute set trigger with a required value and a positional index. Just used to reduce the amount of coding required :)

Parameters:
paramName - Name of the parameter to create the trigger from
paramVal - The value of said triggered
required - Whether this trigger triggered means that the parameter must be used
index - The positional index of this parameter in the tag or function call
Returns:
The newly created trigger

WillTrigger

public int WillTrigger(java.util.HashMap params)
Returns whether the trigger has, um, triggered or not.

Parameters:
params - The attributes/parameters currently set.
Returns:
PARAM_TRIGGERD | PARAM_REQUIRED (triggered & required) PARAM_TRIGGERED (simply triggered, therefore optional) PARAM_NOTTRIGGERED (not triggered, technically optional)
